{"step_by_step_thinking": "Acrocephaly is a form of craniosynostosis, a condition where the sutures in the skull of an infant close too early, causing problems with normal brain and skull growth. It is characterized by a high, pointed skull, hence the name 'acrocephaly' which means 'high head'. This condition is also known as oxycephaly. Turticephaly and dome shaped skull are not synonyms for acrocephaly.", "answer_choice": "A"}
